title: Schisms in Christianity - Collection 8
description:
Schisms in Christianity - Collection 8:

We have 35 titles here:

-  Bast (Ed.) - The Reformation of Faith in the Context of Late Medieval Theology and Piety; Essays by Berndt Hamm (2004)

-  Bradstock - Radical Religion in Cromwell's England; a Concise History from the English Civil War to the End of the Commonwealth (2011)

-  Brady - German Histories in the Age of Reformations, 1400-1650 (2009)

-  Bromiley (Ed.) - Zwingli and Bullinger (1953)

-  Bruening - Calvinism's First Battleground; Conflict and Reform in the Pays de Vaud, 1528-1559 (2005)

-  Childs - God's Traitors; Terror & Faith in Elizabethan England (2014)

-  Christiansen - The Northern Crusades (1997)

-  Fonnesberg-Schmidt - The Popes and the Baltic Crusades 1147-1254 (2007)

-  Gaukroger & Scott - Wars of Religion, Western Europe, 1610-1660 (2010)

-  Gayk - Image, Text, and Religious Reform in Fifteenth-Century England (2010)

-  Goudriaan - Reformed Orthodoxy and Philosophy, 1625-1750 (2006)

-  Gracia - Individuation in Scholasticism; the Later Middle Ages and the Counter-Reformation, 1150-1650 (1994)

-  Greengrass - Christendom Destroyed, Europe 1517-1648 (2014)

-  Gross - The War against Catholicism; Liberalism and the Anti-Catholic Imagination in Nineteenth-Century Germany (2004)

-  Gunther - Reformation Unbound; Protestant Visions of Reform in England, 1525-1590 (2014)

-  Janssen - The Dutch Revolt and Catholic Exile in Reformation Europe (2014)

-  Johnson - John Calvin; Reformer for the 21st Century (2009)

-  Lindholm & Nicolle - The Scandinavian Baltic Crusades 1100-1500 (2007)

-  Marotti - Catholicism and Anti-Catholicism in Early Modern English Texts (1999)

-  Martin - The Occitan War; a Military and Political History of the Albigensian Crusade, 1209Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1218 (2008)

-  McIntire - England Against the Papacy, 1858-1861; Tories, Liberals, and the Overthrow of Papal Temporal Power .. (1983)

-  McNally - Ireland 1649-52; Cromwell's Protestant Crusade (2009)

-  Miller - Cities Divided; Politics and Religion in English Provincial Towns 1660-1722  (2007)

-  Mullet - Historical Dictionary of the Reformation and Counter-Reformation (2010)

-  Newman - The Reformation from a Baptist Point of View (1884)

-  Oberman - The Reformation; Roots and Ramifications (1994)

-  Ozment - The Age of Reform, 1250-1550; an Intellectual and Religious History of Late Medieval and Reformation Europe (1980)

-  Pascoe - Church and Reform; Bishops, Theologians, and Canon Lawyers in the Thought of Pierre D'ailly 1351-1420 (2005)

-  Pegg - A Most Holy War; the Albigensian Crusade and the Battle for Christendom (2008)

-  Saarinen - Weakness of Will in Renaissance and Reformation Thought (2011)

-  Scheck - Reform and Resistance; Formations of Female Subjectivity in Early Medieval Ecclesiastical Culture (2008)

-  Siecienski - The Filioque; History of a Doctrinal Controversy (2010)

-  Thiery - Polluting the Sacred; Violence, Faith and the 'Civilizing' of Parishioners in Late Medieval England (2009)

-  Thomas - A House Divided; Wittelsbach Confessional Court Cultures in the Holy Roman Empire, 1550-1650 (2010)

-  Whiting - The Blind Devotion of the People; Popular Religion and the English Reformation (1989)
